intro: Gouldia axillaris f. lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gouldia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers, which are often fragrant. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. This ornamental plant is popular in gardens for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
